definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to atone for one's crime/to buy freedom from punishment/redemption/atonement
to atone for one's crimes by meritorious acts
price paid to redeem an object/(religion) price paid to redeem sb/ransom
Yom Kippur or Day of Atonement (Jewish holiday)
the Yom Kippur war of October 1973 between Israel and her Arab neighbors

sentences.english: Er water side edge, the blood was buried in the autumn flowers, not hae atonement.
sentences.chinese: 洱水畔邊，血葬秋花，贖不盡前塵的罪。

sentences.english: Christ expiated the sins and propitiated the divine wrath for all his people.
sentences.chinese: 基督替祂的子民贖了他們的罪，並且挽回了神的忿怒。

sentences.english: For thus saith the LORD, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華如此說，你們是無價被賣的，也必無銀被贖。

sentences.english: Cases of kidnaping are gradually rising during recent years, especially in the southeast coast area.
sentences.chinese: 近幾年來，綁架勒贖案件增多，危害日益嚴重。

sentences.english: Everyone has a sad, want to hide is.
sentences.chinese: 贖縭每個人都有一段悲傷，想隱藏卻欲蓋彌彰。

sentences.english: So Cai Yan in this year, I was probably in a year redemption Guihan.
sentences.chinese: 所以蔡琰在這一年，被贖歸漢很可能在一年。

sentences.english: Good is knowing that you're headed for heaven through Christ's atoning death.
sentences.chinese: 知道藉着耶穌代贖的死，你能直往天堂，這便是好處。

sentences.english: He's probably pawned it till next pay day.
sentences.chinese: 他也許把他當掉了，到下次發薪日再把它贖回來。

sentences.english: Crews are usually freed after a ransom is paid.
sentences.chinese: 船員一般在被贖之後就會被釋放。

sentences.english: Cliegg purchased Shmi's freedom and, soon after, made her his bride.
sentences.chinese: 克利格爲施密贖得自由，而且很快就娶她爲妻。

sentences.english: Now i was to expiate all my offences at the gallows .
sentences.chinese: 現在我將在絞刑架上贖我一切的罪過。

sentences.english: Redeem every firstborn among your sons.
sentences.chinese: 凡你兒子中頭生的都要贖出來。

sentences.english: We’re also seeing the reverberations of this crisis with the rise in foreclosures.
sentences.chinese: 這場危機仍然餘波未了，房屋止贖數量還在上升。

sentences.english: For example, I've already said Mark believes that Jesus' death was a ransom.
sentences.chinese: 比如說，我講過馬可認爲耶穌的死是一種償贖。

sentences.english: The fear of our heart, forever is more than the real danger of huge.
sentences.chinese: 贖縭我們心中的恐懼，永遠比真正的危險巨大的多。

sentences.english: The proper function of man is to live, but not to exist.
sentences.chinese: 贖縭人應該生活，而非單純生存。

definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)
to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
